clinical_particulars.therapeutic_indications: Investigated for use treatment in arrhythmia and atrial fibrillation

contraindications.pharmacodynamics: Azimilide is a new class III anti arrhythmic agent It is distinguished by a relative lack of reverse use dependence excellent oral absorption no need for dose titration an option for out patient initiation no need for adjustment associated with renal or liver failure and a lack of interaction with warfarin or digoxin It carries some risk of torsade de pointes and rarely neutropoenia
